    • isValidMove

      public boolean isValidMove(Player current, int row, int col, int destRow, int destCol)
      This method checks if the player making a move can legally make that move following the rules outlined by the checkers game rules The logic used in this is if the player is the 'o' piece player the game board will check if the column is +- 1 from the current column and the row is +1 from the current row, without a skip and opposite for the 'x' piece player. If the row or column is outside the scope of the game board array, then it will return false. This method is public to ensure the current player can move the piece to a valid location in the text console
      Parameters:
      current - the current Player, used to check for the game piece
      row - the row that the piece they want to move
      col - the column of the piece they want to move
      destRow - the row where the piece will move to
      destCol - the column where the piece will move to
      Returns:
      if the move is valid

    • makeMove

      public void makeMove(Player current, int row, int col, int destRow, int destCol, Player opponent)
      This method changes the array to reflect the valid move made by the player. In using this method, it will verify that the move is valid before updating the game board. This could be redundant in the logic pf the CheckersTextCosole, due to the algorithm from the com.example.checkers.ui checking for a valid move already, however this just guarantees the program can run smoothly isolated from the isValidMove method.
      Parameters:
      current - the current Player, used to check for the gamepiece
      row - the row that the piece they want to move
      col - the column of the piece they want to move
      destRow - the row where the piece will move to
      destCol - the column where the piece will move to

      Returns:

    • makeMoveCPU

      public Point2D[] makeMoveCPU(CPUPlayer cpu, Player player)
      Randomly generates a move for the CPU to execute, goes through validation to ensure the move is possible
      Parameters:
      cpu - the computer player
      player - the human player
      Returns:
      the 2 points, the index 0 is the original point, and index 1 is the destination for a piece

      public boolean checkForVSCPU()
